meta.description: Hand-crafted seed set demonstrating v3 clerk-as-character philosophy
purpose: Serve as test cases for generator

soldiers._comment: Canonical truth records for 12 soldiers across components with deliberate collisions

S004._collision_note: Regiment 505 PIR, Battalion is alpha (A), Company is numeric (2)

S007._collision_note: Regiment 1 collides with 1st ID, 2nd ID, 101st AB, 36th ID

S012._collision_note: Battalion designator overlaps with alpha battalion designators in airborne

S013._transfer_note: TRANSFERRED: Originally C Co, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf. Now B Co, 1st Bn, 18th Inf. Regiment-level transfer within 1st ID.

transfers._comment: 25% of soldiers have unit transfers. This section documents transfer cases in seed set.

S013_brennan._notes: Regiment-level transfer (15% of transfers). Brennan moved from 16th to 18th Infantry within 1st ID. Both assignments are valid ground truth.

sources._comment: Each source represents a physical document produced by one clerk in one situation

clerk_instance.name: Cpl. Helen Marchetti
clerk_instance.context: 29th Division HQ, processing personnel rosters after Normandy consolidation

clerk_instance.name: Pfc. Robert Trane
clerk_instance.context: 2nd Battalion S-1, 16th Infantry. Processing after-action casualty list under time pressure.

clerk_instance.name: T/5 Margaret Hollis
clerk_instance.context: Troop Carrier Command, processing jump manifest for Normandy drop

clerk_instance.name: Pvt. James Delacroix
clerk_instance.context: Field hospital admissions, 72 hours since landing. Handwritten intake log.

clerk_instance.name: Cpl. Theodore Wojcik
clerk_instance.context: Transport ship manifest, pre-landing Guadalcanal. Column-based system.

clerk_instance.name: S/Sgt. Vincent Calabrese
clerk_instance.context: 91st Bomb Group operations, tracking mission crew assignments

entries._comment: Rendered entries showing clerk-consistent output with situational vocabulary

E001.raw_text: S/Sgt Kowalski, Stanley J.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
E001._notes: HQ formal: full hierarchy, proper abbreviations, prefix rank

E002.raw_text: Pfc Murphy, James R.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
E002._notes: Same format as E001 - clerk consistency

E003.raw_text: Sgt Chen, William  Co F, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
E003._notes: No middle initial (soldier has none) - format otherwise identical

E004.raw_text: 2nd Lt Nowak, Edward T.  Co F, 2nd Bn, 85th Mtn, 10th Div
E004._notes: Different unit but same clerk format - 10th Mountain soldier on roster

E005.raw_text: Cpl Kim, Harold  Co C, 66th Tk Bn, CCA, 2nd AD
E005._notes: Armored structure rendered in clerk's consistent style

E006._notes: Battalion clerk: terse, drops division, everyone knows context

E007._notes: Identical format to E006 - within-source consistency

E009._notes: Same soldier again (duplicate record), situational vocab appears

E010.raw_text: Cpl Thompson, Robert L.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42
E010._notes: Airborne structure: alpha battalion, numeric company. Chalk number from manifest.

E011.raw_text: Pvt O'Brien, Michael F.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42
E011._notes: Same stick (chalk 42) as Thompson - situational coherence

E012.raw_text: T/5 Russo, Anthony V.  1st Co, B Bn, 507th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-67

E013.raw_text: Cpl Thompson, Robert L.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42 C-47

E014.raw_text: Pvt O'Brien, Michael F.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42 DZ-O
E014._notes: Drop zone added - all situational vocab from normandy_airborne

E015.raw_text: Kowalski Stanley  SSgt Easy Co 16  WIA
E015._notes: Field exhausted: phonetic company, status code, no punctuation

E016.raw_text: Murphy James  Pfc Easy 16  WIA OMAHA
E016._notes: Even more abbreviated - fatigue showing. Situational vocab.

E017._notes: Phonetic company (Fox = F). Slightly different format - field clerk inconsistency.

E018._notes: Airborne soldier at same field hospital - minimal unit info, ABN marker

E019._notes: Ship manifest: columnar, parent-over-child slash, rank at end

E020._notes: Identical format - ship clerk is very consistent

E024._notes: AAF ops clerk: compact group-squadron, aircraft type

E029._notes: Same crew, same status - coherent within source

entries._comment_clutter: ENTRIES WITH CONTEXTUAL CLUTTER - Non-signal noise from clerk environment

E030.raw_text: SULLIVAN J    E/2/1  1MARDIV  SGT  Dk2 Bth-C
E030._notes: Ship clutter: Deck 2, Berth C. These are ship locations, not unit data.

E031.raw_text: DAVIS R    E/2/1  1MARDIV  PFC  Dk2 Hold3
E031._notes: Ship clutter: Deck 2, Hold 3. Same deck as Sullivan (coherent grouping).

E032.raw_text: Murphy James  Pfc Easy 16  WIA Ward3 Bed12
E032._notes: Hospital clutter: Ward 3, Bed 12. Field hospital intake.

E033.raw_text: Martinelli, F.J.  91BG-322  SSGT  B-17 AC847 Pos3
E033._notes: AAF clutter: Aircraft serial 847, Position 3 (crew position).

E034.raw_text: S/Sgt Kowalski, Stanley J.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div  Grp7
E034._notes: HQ clutter: Processing Group 7. Even formal clerks sometimes add admin codes.

entries._comment_confounders: ENTRIES WITH CONFOUNDERS - Deliberately ambiguous terms

E035._notes: CONFOUNDER: Bare 'A' at end. Is this Company A or Berth A? Parser cannot tell from this entry alone.
E035.ground_truth: Berth A (not unit data - soldier is in E Company)

E036._notes: CONFOUNDER: 'C-4' looks like Company C, 4th Bn. But this is Compartment C-4 on transport.
E036.ground_truth: Compartment C-4 (soldier is in E Company, 2nd Bn)

E037.raw_text: Cpl Thompson, Robert L.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42 2A
E037._notes: CONFOUNDER: '2A' looks like 2nd Co, A Bn (which is true!). But this is also a valid boarding group code. Ambiguous whether it's redundant unit info or transport code.
E037.ground_truth: Boarding group 2A (happens to match unit structure - realistic coincidence)

E038._notes: CONFOUNDER: '??' indicates clerk uncertainty. Something was illegible or unknown.

entries._comment_transfers: ENTRIES FOR TRANSFERRED SOLDIERS - Same soldier, different valid assignments

E039.raw_text: Pfc Brennan, Thomas E.  Co C, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
E039._notes: TRANSFER: Original assignment. Brennan was in C Co, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf before transfer.

E040._notes: TRANSFER: Original assignment, rushed format. Same soldier as E041 but different unit.

E041._notes: TRANSFER: New assignment after transfer. B Co, 1st Bn, 18th Inf. Appears to conflict with E040 but both are correct.

collision_demonstrations._comment: Explicit examples showing how the same unit designators require disambiguation

regiment_1_collision.description: Regiment 1 appears in 5 different divisions - requires service/type signals to disambiguate

examples.raw_text: Sgt Chen, William  Co F, 2nd Bn, 1st Inf, 1st Div
Pvt Garcia, M.  1st Co, A Bn, 1st PIR, 101st AB

battalion_alpha_collision.description: Battalion 'A' appears in both airborne (as designator) and armored (as Combat Command)

examples.raw_text: Cpl Thompson, Robert L.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB
Cpl Kim, Harold  Co C, 66th Tk Bn, CCA, 2nd AD
examples.interpretation: A in CCA = Combat Command A, not battalion

ambiguous_without_context.description: Entries that are genuinely ambiguous without additional signals

examples.notes: Regiment 16 exists in both 1st ID and 29th ID. Requires source-level context or additional entries to disambiguate.
505th PIR is unique to 82nd, but 'ABN' alone wouldn't distinguish from 101st without regiment.

within_source_consistency_examples._comment: Demonstrating that entries from the same source look nearly identical

entries: S/Sgt Kowalski, Stanley J.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
Pfc Murphy, James R.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
Sgt Chen, William  Co F, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
SRC001_consistency.variation: Only the data changes; format is locked

SRC005_consistency.variation: Columnar format never changes; vocab appended at end

vocabulary_layers_demonstration._comment: Showing the three vocabulary layers: situational, clutter, and confounders

layer_definitions.situational: Signal-bearing terms tied to operation (helps parser disambiguate)
layer_definitions.contextual_clutter: Noise from clerk environment (does NOT help disambiguation)
layer_definitions.confounders: Terms that LOOK like unit data but aren't (actively misleading)

full_entry_breakdown.entry: SULLIVAN J    E/2/1  1MARDIV  SGT  Dk2 Bth-C  A

core.meaning: Name, unit hierarchy, rank (from clerk style)

situational.note: No operation-specific vocab like LUNGA or RED-1

contextual_clutter.meaning: Deck 2, Berth C - ship locations, NOT unit data

confounder.meaning: Bare letter - could be Company A or Berth A. Parser cannot distinguish without context.

situational_helps.entry: Kowalski Stanley  SSgt Easy Co 16  WIA OMAHA
situational_helps.disambiguation_value: OMAHA strongly signals 1st ID or 29th ID (D-Day beach sector)
situational_helps.note: Without OMAHA, regiment 16 could be from multiple divisions

clutter_does_not_help.entry: DAVIS R    E/2/1  1MARDIV  PFC  Dk2 Hold3
clutter_does_not_help.disambiguation_value: None - these are ship locations, not unit signals
clutter_does_not_help.note: Parser should ignore these for unit disambiguation

confounder_actively_misleads.note: Parser must recognize Kowalski is E Company (from E2-16), so C-4 cannot be company

transport_ship.example: SULLIVAN J    E/2/1  1MARDIV  SGT  Dk2 Bth-C

field_medevac.example: Murphy James  Pfc Easy 16  WIA Ward3 Bed12

aaf_operations.example: Martinelli, F.J.  91BG-322  SSGT  B-17 AC847 Pos3

repldep_intake.example: S/Sgt Kowalski, Stanley J.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div  Grp7

cross_source_soldier_comparison._comment: Same soldier rendered by different clerks

S001_kowalski.soldier: S001 - Stanley Joseph Kowalski, S/Sgt, E Co, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st ID

renderings.raw_text: S/Sgt Kowalski, Stanley J.  Co E, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div
Kowalski Stanley  SSgt Easy Co 16  WIA

S001_kowalski.notes: Three completely different formats for the same soldier - parser must recognize all as equivalent

S004_thompson.soldier: S004 - Robert Lee Thompson, Cpl, 2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB

renderings.raw_text: Cpl Thompson, Robert L.  2nd Co, A Bn, 505th PIR, 82nd AB  CHK-42

S004_thompson.notes: Airborne soldier: full manifest format vs minimal field hospital intake

S007_sullivan.soldier: S007 - John Patrick Sullivan, Sgt, E Co, 2nd Bn, 1st Marines, 1st MarDiv
S007_sullivan.notes: Same clerk, same format - only situational vocab varies

transfer_demonstration._comment: Showing the disambiguation challenge created by soldier transfers

S013_brennan.transfer: C Co, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf â†’ B Co, 1st Bn, 18th Inf (regiment-level)

renderings.raw_text: Pfc Brennan, Thomas E.  Co C, 2nd Bn, 16th Inf, 1st Div

disambiguation_challenge.problem: E040 shows C2-16 (C Co, 2nd Bn, 16th). E041 shows B1-18 (B Co, 1st Bn, 18th). These appear to conflict.
possible_interpretations: Parsing error in one of the entries
Valid transfer - both assignments correct for this soldier
disambiguation_challenge.ground_truth: Valid transfer. Both assignments are correct at different points in time.
disambiguation_challenge.parser_implication: Parser cannot resolve without additional context. Should flag as potential multi-assignment case.

S013_brennan.notes: This is the hardest case: same name, same division (1st ID), two different regiments. Without dates, parser cannot know which is 'current'.

transfer_type_distribution._comment: 25% of soldiers have transfers, distributed as follows:
transfer_type_distribution.company_level: 50% - Same battalion, different company (easiest to detect as same soldier)
transfer_type_distribution.regiment_level: 15% - Same division, different regiment (hard - like S013)
transfer_type_distribution.division_level: 5% - Different division entirely (hardest - appears to be two different soldiers)
